column2: Number and percentage of public school students not served under IDEA subjected to mechanical restraint, by race/ethnicity, whether served under Section 504, and English proficiency, by state: School Year 2013-14

column18: Students With Disabilities Served Only Under Section 504

column8: Hispanic or Latino of any race
column14: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

column2: NOTE: Table reads (for US Totals):  Of all 4,062 public school students not served under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA) subjected to mechanical restraint, 53 (1.3%) were American Indian or Alaska Native.
Students not served under IDEA are the students without disabilities and those with disabilities served solely under Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973.
The ‘1-3’ reference indicates that the data have been suppressed based on the schools’ reported n-size, and that the midpoint was used to calculate the total.

SOURCE: U.S. Department of Education, Office for Civil Rights, Civil Rights Data Collection, 2013-14, available at http://ocrdata.ed.gov. Data notes are available on the Data Notes page, under Additional Resources at  http://ocrdata.ed.gov/DataNotes.
